channel.title: Make Int changes happen to EVERYONE?
channel.description: say i have an int, is there a way that the int can go up and count for everyone? or a boolean happen for everyone? like if there was boolean idleDestroyed = false; then the idle gets destroyed and it goes idleDestroyed = true; i need to make it so that everyones goes true and not just that 1 person

item.title: Make Int changes happen to EVERYONE?
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Wait nvm, you could just declare [tt]public static boolean idleDestroyed;[/tt] in your client class and modify it whenever. Also, still check its status in the process method.

Read full topic
item.source: Make Int changes happen to EVERYONE?

item.title: Make Int changes happen to EVERYONE?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:2, topic:223252”]Declare that boolean in [tt]server[/tt] class and during your process() method in [tt]client[/tt] class make sure to check the value of that boolean. Something like:

public boolean process() { //every 500 milliseconds (or w/e it says) if (server.idleDestroyed) { //handle } .... //rest of process method } [/quote]
You forgot to include it would have to be static.

Read full topic
item.source: Make Int changes happen to EVERYONE?

item.title: Make Int changes happen to EVERYONE?
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Declare that boolean in [tt]server[/tt] class and during your process() method in [tt]client[/tt] class make sure to check the value of that boolean. Something like:

public boolean process() { //every 500 milliseconds (or w/e it says)
     if (server.idleDestroyed) {
          //handle
     }
     .... //rest of process method
}

Read full topic
